page.title: 05ST. AUBIN'S VILLAGE
page.content: St. Aubin's village and harbour is one of the most attractive places in Jersey. At one time it was the principal harbour of the island. The first harbour was built in the 16th C. Privateers brought their booty here. The captured goods were stored in the cellar of the Court House, now an inn. In later years the harbour and the adjacent bay were used for boat building. There are still a few boat yards around the harbour today. The buildings of the village, constructed on the hillsides above the harbour make an attractive skyline. There are now a number of hotels and many restaurants, but the village is still a place for family homes. The little back streets, much admired by tourists, are the playground for many children. The harbour is a focus for many local pleasure boat owners.
